answers.answer: Hi, if you suddenly seem to have excessive saliva in your mouth, it could be because your salivary glands are making more saliva than usual (sialorrhea) or because you're having difficulty swallowing. But your problem has been present chronically.  It can sometimes occur due to GERD, (Gastro Esophageal Reflux Disease), where the acid contents of the stomach come up into the esophagus. It can also occur due to chronic infections like tuberculosis or facial palsy. Check with your doctor tor uel out these conditions. Treating them may help resolve your problem. Regards.
